item.title: Vision/Mission Statement
item.description: The LRC aims to promote a wholistic formation of the students as well as the faculty and the whole community through developing enthusiasm and passion for reading by providing a rich and relevant collection of reading and audio visual materials to meet the recreational, cultural, spiritual, emotional, and academic needs of the community.

item.title: Learning Resource Center
item.description: The Matilda L. Bradford Christian School, Inc. Learning Resource Center (LRC) is an integral part of the School and contributes to the realization of its objectives by providing and making available materials and services needed for the students’ formation and education. LRC provides services mainly to MLBCSI students, faculty, administration and the school staff.

item.title: Health and Safety
item.description: The Safety and Security Office (SSO) ensures the delivery of programs, services, and activities in the areas of safety and security including, but not limited to health and sanitation, campus traffic, security, campus emergency incidents and the implementation of the School-based Disaster Risk Reduction Management Plan. The office plans, and monitors all campus emergency incidents in addition to the school-based disaster risk reduction and management activities. It works closely with other offices such as the Physical Plant Office in conducting regular in campus risk and hazard assessments, and makes appropriate recommendations for safety.

item.title: Commitments Services
item.description: Its commitments and services include: To deliver and implement culture and arts programs; To recognize and acknowledge MLBCSI artistic potentials and cultural & historical heritages; To develop and sustain artistic resources for the school’s community; To provide alternative artistic enrichment activities aligned with the academic requirements of the school for avenues of holistic and interactive educational environment; To create policies for the development of culture and the arts in the school; To lead in attaining a sustainable eminence in culture and the arts complementary with other institutions and schools in Central Visayas; To forge partnerships, linkages and collaborations with local counterparts, patrons, national and international culture and the arts funding institutions and agencies.

item.title: Culture and Arts Program
item.description: Matilda L. Bradford Christian School, Inc. Arts and Culture Programs draw on the potency, power and relevance of culture, in particular artistic and expressive culture rooted in Ignatian ideals, to help build and maintain the core values of the school, promoting the competencies of the progressively growing community and building character of the recipient populace. The thrust of achieving balanced programming is exemplified in the continuous enriching and engaging events and projects related to both international and local culture & arts appreciation and development of the students, and the school community in general.

item.title: Character Prefects
item.description: Discipline is a shared and complementary effort of all school authorities, “the substitute parents.” As a community that cares for one another, Matilda L. Bradford Christian School, Inc. views school discipline as a shared effort among adult community members – the teachers, staff and administrators. The Character Prefect Offices of the Student Formation of the Grade School, Junior High, and Senior High School departments play an active role in the observance and promotion of discipline.

item.title: Guidance Services
item.description: The Guidance Services of each department offers a variety of programs and services for the holistic and mental well-being of the student in the spirit of cura personalis.

item.title: Varsity Program
item.description: Comprehensive program of multi-events for 10 to 18 years old (ladderized program for boys & girls) Training (year-round) Competitions (scheduled across the year) Compete in competitions locally, nationally and even internationally. VARSITY PROGRAM SPORTS/EVENTS Basketball Volleyball Football Futsal Taekwondo Lawn Tennis Table Tennis Sports (Track and Field) Swimming Triathlon

item.title: Goal
item.description: Matilda L. Bradford Christian School, Inc. aims to be recognized as an academic institution known for its quality education (academics) with one of the best sports program in Cebu whose students are well-rounded in academics and sports

item.title: Social Involvement
item.description: Through the Student Formation Program and the Campus Ministry and Social Involvement Office (CMSIO), the school’s mission is to form men and women for others, who are committed to promoting social justice, peace, and environmental sustainability. The social involvement programs aim to foster a sense of social responsibility, empathy, and compassion among the students. These programs provide opportunities for the students to engage in service projects and outreach programs that address the needs of the less fortunate and marginalized sectors of society.

item.title: Student Activity Program (SAP)
item.description: The Student Activity Program (SAP) of Matilda L. Bradford Christian School, Inc. aims to provide students with opportunities to participate in various activities outside of the academic curriculum. The SAP is designed to promote holistic development, enhance students’ skills and talents, and provide a platform for socialization and community involvement. To know more about the Student Activity Program (SAP) of each department, visit the link below.
